marketNews.title: MYOR 3Q24: Loss on Exchange and Margin Pressured Again, Below Expectation
marketNews.content: Mayora Indah (MYOR) recorded low net profit in 3Q24 amounting to 298 billion rupiah (-63% YoY, -51% QoQ). This result keeps the net profit for 9M24 relatively stable at 2 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY). We assess this achievement is below expectations because it is only equivalent to 60% of the consensus FY24 net profit estimates. For comparison, MYOR's net profit in 9M23 was equivalent to 63% of the total FY23 net profit. Exchange Loss Due to Rupiah Strengthening Net profit in 3Q24 was also suppressed by a net exchange loss of 257 billion rupiah (3Q23: profit of 33 billion rupiah, 2Q24: profit of 98 billion rupiah). This was caused by the strengthening of the Rupiah against the US Dollar to the level of ~15,100 by the end of September 2024. For information, MYOR holds a net cash position in US dollars amounting to ~280 million US dollars as of the end of September 2024, thus the company will incur exchange losses when the US Dollar weakens against the Rupiah. Operating Profit Pressed by Declining Gross Profit Margin and Rising OPEX Operationally, operating profit was recorded at 726 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (-31% YoY, +5% QoQ). This realization brought the operating profit for 9M24 to 2.7 trillion rupiah (-2% YoY), slightly below expectations as it amounted to 63% of the consensus FY24 estimate (vs. 9M23: 65% of FY23). The weak operating profit in 3Q24 was mainly caused by: 1) continued pressure from cocoa and coffee raw material prices on the gross profit margin; and 2) an increase in opex. The gross profit margin decreased again in 3Q24 to 20.5% (vs. 3Q23: 26.9%, 2Q24: 23.5%), marking a decline for 2 consecutive quarters. This result caused the gross profit margin for 9M24 to drop to 23.9% (vs. 9M23: 26.7%), creating a risk that the gross profit margin for FY24 will be below management guidance which targets a minimum level of 25%. With the pressure still being felt on the gross profit margin, MYOR will likely implement plans to raise product selling prices again in the remainder of this year. MYOR management will hold an earnings call on November 5, 2024, where we will focus on the company's gross profit margin dynamics. We assess that the gross profit margin is the main issue for MYOR, considering that the company's revenue grew solidly to 9.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+17% YoY, +26% QoQ). This growth brought revenue for 9M24 up +12% YoY to 25.6 trillion rupiah, in line with the new guidance provided by management in the range of +10-12%. Meanwhile, opex increased, especially in general and administrative expenses (+29% YoY, +15% QoQ) along with a surge in salary expenses (+21% YoY, +17% QoQ). We expect this cost increase is related to the opening of the company's 2 new factories. Key Takeaway Although MYOR in 4Q24 potentially posts an exchange loss reversal due to the strengthening of the US Dollar exchange rate, we assess that the company's success in facing challenges from the gross profit margin side will be a key factor for its stock price movement. This is considering that cocoa and chocolate raw material prices are still holding at relatively high levels as of now.

marketNews.title: ERAA 9M24: Net Profit +60% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
marketNews.content: ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada recorded a net profit of 268 billion rupiah (+640% YoY, +0% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the net profit for 9M24 to 791 billion rupiah (+60% YoY), exceeding expectations as it is equivalent to 83% of the consensus FY24F estimate. For comparison, ERAA's net profit in 9M23 was equivalent to 60% of the total FY23 net profit. The increase in net profit in 3Q24 was driven by: 1) revenue growth (+11% YoY, -6% QoQ); 2) GPM expansion to 12% (+191 bps YoY, +145 bps QoQ); and 3) growth in other income due to increased promotion support to 60 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q23: 5 billion rupiah), resulting in operating profit growth of +119% YoY to 520 billion rupiah.

marketNews.title: BRMS Production and Financing Update
marketNews.content: BRMS: The President Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Agoes Projosasmito, stated that they recorded gold production of 45,366 oz (+176% YoY) during 9M24, having already exceeded the 2024 target of 35,000 oz and the 2023 realization of 23,270 oz. The average selling price (ASP) reached 2,347 US dollars per oz (+23% YoY) during 9M24. Agoes mentioned that BRMS's 3Q24 financial report is still being audited in line with the company's plan to obtain credit from banks. This credit facility is expected to be obtained in 1Q25, with the funds intended for the construction of the underground mine in Palu, Central Sulawesi, in 2Q25.

marketNews.title: PWON 3Q24 Net Profit Jumps Due to Exchange Gains Hiding Operational Dip
marketNews.content: PWON: Pakuwon Jati recorded a net profit of 816 billion rupiah (+110% YoY, +58% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to ~1.7 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY), equivalent to 79% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Operationally, revenue decreased (-9% YoY, -12% QoQ) in 3Q24, mainly suppressed by a decline in revenue from the Property Development segment (-63% YoY, -65% QoQ). This result caused operating profit in 3Q24 to fall to 658 billion rupiah (-7% YoY, -16% QoQ). Nevertheless, operating profit for 9M24 grew to 2.1 trillion rupiah (+7% YoY), in line with expectations as it amounts to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The surge in PWON's net profit in 3Q24 was driven by an exchange gain of 375 billion rupiah, reversing a loss of 170 billion rupiah in 2Q24 and 157 billion rupiah in 3Q23.

marketNews.title: HMSP 3Q24 Net Profit Down Due to Sales Volume and Margin Pressure
marketNews.content: HMSP: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna recorded a net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah (-22% YoY, -78% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 5.2 trillion rupiah (-16% YoY), below expectations as it is only equivalent to 69% of the consensus FY24 estimate. For comparison, HMSP's net profit realization in 9M23 was equivalent to 77% of the total FY23 net profit. The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was pressured by a decrease in sales volume (-9% YoY) and a gross profit margin decline of -20 bps YoY, even though the average selling price (ASP) rose +8% YoY. Operating expenses in 3Q24 increased +8% YoY, with advertising and promotion expenses surging +21% YoY, resulting in an operating profit in 3Q24 of 2.4 trillion rupiah (-12% YoY).

marketNews.title: ADMR 3Q24 Net Profit Declined QoQ and YoY Despite Stable Margin
marketNews.content: ADMR: Adaro Minerals Indonesia recorded a net profit of 84 million US dollars (-37% QoQ, -3% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 333 million US dollars (+33% YoY), equivalent to 76.5% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was caused by a revenue decline (-30% QoQ, -9% YoY) which was deeper than the decline in the cost of revenue (-20% QoQ, -3% YoY), causing the gross profit margin to drop to 45.6% (vs. 3Q23: 49.1%, 2Q24: 52%).

marketNews.title: BRIS 9M24 Net Profit Up 22% YoY Led by Other Operating Income
marketNews.content: BRIS: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded a net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah (+1.5% QoQ, +24% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 5.1 trillion rupiah (+22% YoY), equivalent to 75% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Net profit in 3Q24 was driven by other operating income which grew significantly (+16 QoQ, +35% YoY), so that other operating income during 9M24 reached 3.2 trillion rupiah (+33% YoY). Additionally, provision expenses in 3Q24 eased (-4.1% QoQ, -4% YoY), so that provision expenses during 9M24 decreased to 1.7 trillion rupiah (-25% YoY). On the top line, net profit sharing revenue grew to 4.7 trillion rupiah (+6.2% QoQ, +8% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in net profit sharing revenue for 9M24 reaching 13.5 trillion rupiah (+4.6% YoY).

marketNews.title: TOWR Announces Rights Issue with PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan as Standby Buyer
marketNews.content: TOWR: Sarana Menara Nusantara announced that PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan (DIA) will act as a standby buyer in the rights issue that the company will hold. DIA is an investment holding company owned by Robert Budi Hartono and Bambang Hartono. Previously, TOWR announced plans for a rights issue of up to 5 billion new shares with a ratio of 1,001:100 and a dilution effect of up to 9.08%. The exercise price for the rights issue is 900 rupiah per share, resulting in potential fund acquisition reaching 4.5 trillion rupiah. These funds are intended for loan repayment and working capital for the company and/or its subsidiary, PT Profesional Telekomunikasi Indonesia. Cum right in the regular and negotiation market on December 12, 2024.

marketNews.title: MTEL 9M24 Net Profit Slightly Below Expectation Due to Lower Other Income
marketNews.content: MTEL: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi recorded a net profit of 468 billion rupiah (+15% YoY, -14% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 1.5 trillion rupiah (+7% YoY), slightly below expectations because it is equivalent to 70% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The lower than expected growth realization of net profit was caused by a decrease in other income to 45 billion rupiah (-74% YoY) and an increase in tax expense (+16% YoY). At the operational level, operating profit in 3Q24 reached 1 trillion rupiah (+18% YoY, +3% QoQ), so that operating profit for 9M24 reached 3.1 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY) and was in line with expectations as it amounted to 73% of the consensus FY24 estimate.

marketNews.title: AUTO 9M24 Net Profit Up 17% YoY, Lower Operating Profit Trend
marketNews.content: AUTO: Astra Otoparts recorded a net profit of 515 billion rupiah (+2% YoY, -5% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 1.5 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY). The lower annual net profit growth in 3Q24 compared to 1H24 (+26% YoY) was due to lower growth in other income. Operating profit itself was recorded at 304 billion rupiah (-9% YoY, +37% QoQ) in 3Q24, so that operating profit for 9M24 reached 793 billion rupiah (-7% YoY).

marketNews.title: DMAS 3Q24 Net Profit Skyrockets Nearly 39x YoY Due to Low Base Effect
marketNews.content: DMAS: Puradelta Lestari recorded a net profit of 320 billion rupiah (-27% QoQ) in 3Q24, soaring almost 39 times compared to the 3Q23 net profit of 8 billion rupiah. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 1.1 trillion rupiah (+85% YoY), equivalent to 91% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The surge in net profit in 3Q24 was caused by a low-base effect following low revenue recognition in 3Q23 (vs. 3Q24: 485 billion rupiah). Revenue for 9M24 reached 1.7 trillion rupiah (+72% YoY), equivalent to 93.6%/87% of the company's target/consensus.

marketNews.title: MIKA 9M24 Net Profit Up 27% YoY Driven by Margin Expansion
marketNews.content: MIKA: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat recorded a net profit of 272 billion rupiah (+17% YoY, -13% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 873 billion rupiah (+27% YoY), equivalent to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The increase in net profit during 9M24 was driven by revenue growth (+5.3% YoY) and gross profit margin expansion to 53.4% (+320 bps YoY).

marketNews.title: HYGN 3Q24 Net Profit Up Despite Margin Contraction Amid Expansion Costs
marketNews.content: HYGN: Ecocare Indo Pasifik recorded a net profit of 5 billion rupiah (+7% YoY, +25% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brings the 9M24 net profit to 10.3 billion rupiah (-5% YoY). The decrease in net profit during 9M24 was suppressed by a decline in other income to 2.7 billion rupiah (-41% YoY). Operationally, revenue grew (+27% YoY, +0.3% QoQ) in 3Q24, but the cost of revenue grew higher (+41% YoY and +1.4% QoQ) along with plans for expansion into new markets. As a result, the gross profit margin in 3Q24 fell to 36.8% (-640 bps YoY, -70 bps QoQ).

marketNews.title: Petronas Plans Aggressive Expansion in East Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Head of Petronas in Indonesia, Yuzaini Md Yusof, stated that his party plans to expand aggressively in Indonesia, although he did not mention definitive investment figures. Yusof mentioned that Petronas plans to build a hub for its 3 operating regions in East Java by connecting production facilities and logistics facilities. Furthermore, Yusof also said that his party has a long-term plan to expand its business portfolio in Eastern Indonesia.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto Scheduled Visits to China and US in November 2024
marketNews.content: Harian Kompas reported that President Prabowo Subianto will make visits to China and the US between November 8-24, 2024. Based on information gathered by Harian Kompas from the Presidential Palace, President Prabowo will conduct a state visit to China to meet with President Xi Jinping, Chinese Premier Li Qiang, and the Chinese Communist Party in Beijing. Subsequently, President Prabowo will meet with the President of the United States, Joe Biden, at the White House, Washington DC. Harian Kompas mentioned that cooperation and efforts to improve the welfare of each country will be central issues during these visits. Besides China and the US, President Prabowo will also depart to Peru to attend the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Summit, visit Brazil to attend the G20 Summit, and visit the UK to meet King Charles and Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

marketNews.title: Government Formulating Income Tax Scheme for Underground Economy Activities
marketNews.content: Vice Minister of Finance, Anggito Abimanyu, stated that President Prabowo Subianto plans to target the underground economy activities - including online gambling and online games - as new tax objects. Anggito mentioned that the income tax (PPh) imposition scheme for underground economy activities is currently being formulated by the government, without further detailing when the regulation regarding this will be released.

marketNews.title: Labor Union to Protest Against Job Creation Law Judicial Review Verdict
marketNews.content: The President of the Confederation of Indonesian Trade Unions, Said Iqbal, stated that his party will demonstrate in front of the Constitutional Court Building, Jakarta, on Thursday (31/10) to oversee the verdict related to the judicial review of Law Number 6 of 2023 on Job Creation. Iqbal mentioned that the number of demonstrators will exceed 1,000 laborers from 60 trade union federations. Besides the Constitutional Court building, demonstrations will also be held in front of the respective provincial governor's offices on the same day, with an estimated number of demonstrators reaching more than 20,000 people.

marketNews.title: SRIL Bankruptcy Will Not Lead to Mass Layoffs, Government Assures
marketNews.content: Vice Minister of Manpower, Immanuel Ebenezer Gerungan, stated that the government guarantees the bankruptcy of Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) will not cause layoffs for its approximately 50,000 workers. The Ministry of Manpower claims that SRIL has no intention of closing its factory and is focusing on continuing operations because its business and financial conditions have shown signs of recovery over the past few years.

marketNews.title: JARR Secures Investment Credit from Bank Mandiri for Refinancing
marketNews.content: Jhonlin Agro Raya (JARR) obtained investment credit amounting to up to 1.4 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI). The credit term is 96 months and is intended for refinancing.

marketNews.title: PT Tancorp Investama Mulia Increases Stake in BLES
marketNews.content: The shareholder of Superior Prima Sukses (BLES), PT Tancorp Investama Mulia, purchased 73.2 million BLES shares at an average price of 241.6 rupiah per share on October 17-24, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~17.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Tancorp Investama Mulia in BLES increased from 10.3% to 11.1%.

tickerNews.title: MYOR 3Q24 Net Profit Falls 63% YoY Due to Exchange Loss and Margin Pressure
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah (MYOR) posted a net profit of 298 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (-63% YoY, -51% QoQ). This decline was significantly influenced by a net exchange loss of 257 billion rupiah in 3Q24, attributed to Rupiah strengthening around 15,100/USD. Operating profit was 726 billion rupiah (-31% YoY), pressured by lower gross profit margin at 20.5% due to input costs like cocoa and coffee, and increased opex. Revenue grew robustly to 9.4 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY). Management plans price hikes to counter margin issues. The company holds ~280 million USD net cash.

tickerNews.title: ERAA 3Q24 Net Profit Soars 640% YoY, 9M24 Net Profit Up 60% YoY
tickerNews.content: Erajaya Swasembada (ERAA) recorded a net profit of 268 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+640% YoY, +0% QoQ), leading to 9M24 net profit of 791 billion rupiah (+60% YoY), exceeding expectations (83% of consensus FY24F estimate). This was driven by 1) revenue growth (+11% YoY); 2) GPM expansion to 12%; and 3) higher promotion support revenue of 60 billion rupiah (vs 5 billion rupiah in 3Q23), boosting operating profit by +119% YoY to 520 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Exceeds 2024 Gold Production Target in 9M24 with High ASP
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS) recorded gold production of 45,366 oz (+176% YoY) during 9M24, surpassing the 35,000 oz target and 23,270 oz output in 2023. The average selling price (ASP) was 2,347 US dollars per oz (+23% YoY). BRMS's 3Q24 financial report is under audit as the company seeks bank credit by 1Q25 to fund its Palu underground mine construction starting 2Q25.

tickerNews.title: PWON 3Q24 Net Profit Quadruples YoY Driven by Currency Gains
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati (PWON) recorded a net profit of 816 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+110% YoY, +58% QoQ), making 9M24 net profit ~1.7 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY), hitting 79% of consensus FY24F estimate. Revenue dropped operationally (-9% YoY, -12% QoQ) due to Property Development segment decline. Operating profit for 9M24 grew +7% YoY to 2.1 trillion rupiah. The sharp 3Q24 net profit increase was fueled by a 375 billion rupiah exchange gain.

tickerNews.title: HMSP 3Q24 Net Profit Falls 22% YoY Amid Sales Volume Dip
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna (HMSP) posted a net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (-22% YoY, -78% QoQ). 9M24 net profit reached 5.2 trillion rupiah (-16% YoY), below expectations (69% of consensus FY24 estimate). The decline stemmed from a -9% YoY drop in sales volume and a 20 bps YoY margin erosion, despite an 8% YoY rise in ASP. Operating expenses rose +8% YoY in 3Q24, led by a +21% YoY jump in advertising and promotion costs, causing 3Q24 operating profit to drop to 2.4 trillion rupiah (-12% YoY).

tickerNews.title: ADMR 3Q24 Net Profit Down 3% YoY Due to Deeper Revenue Drop
tickerNews.content: Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR) recorded a net profit of 84 million US dollars in 3Q24 (-37% QoQ, -3% YoY). 9M24 net profit was 333 million US dollars (+33% YoY), meeting 76.5% of consensus FY24F estimate. The 3Q24 net profit decline resulted from revenue falling by -30% QoQ (-9% YoY), which outpaced the decline in cost of revenue (-20% QoQ, -3% YoY), leading to a gross profit margin drop to 45.6% (vs 49.1% in 3Q23 and 52% in 2Q24).

tickerNews.title: BRIS 3Q24 Net Profit Grows 24% YoY on Strong Other Operating Income
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) recorded a net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+1.5% QoQ, +24% YoY). 9M24 net profit grew +22% YoY to 5.1 trillion rupiah (75% of consensus FY24 estimate). This was driven by other operating income growing significantly (+16 QoQ, +35% YoY), reaching 3.2 trillion rupiah (+33% YoY) for 9M24. Provision expenses eased in 3Q24 (-4.1% QoQ, -4% YoY), leading to 9M24 provision expenses decreasing by 25% YoY to 1.7 trillion rupiah. Net profit sharing revenue in 3Q24 was 4.7 trillion rupiah (+6.2% QoQ, +8% YoY), totaling 13.5 trillion rupiah (+4.6% YoY) for 9M24.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Rights Issue Priced at 900 Rupiah with DIA as Standby Buyer
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR) announced that PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan (DIA), an investment holding company of Robert Budi Hartono and Bambang Hartono, will act as a standby buyer in the rights issue. TOWR plans to issue up to 5 billion new shares (1,001:100 ratio) potentially raising 4.5 trillion rupiah at 900 rupiah per share (9.08% dilution). The funds are for debt payment and working capital for TOWR and/or its subsidiary, PT Profesional Telekomunikasi Indonesia. Cum rights date for regular and negotiation markets is December 12, 2024.

tickerNews.title: MTEL 9M24 Net Profit Slightly Below Expectation Due to Tax Increase and Lower Other Income
tickerNews.content: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL) recorded a net profit of 468 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+15% YoY, -14% QoQ). 9M24 net profit reached 1.5 trillion rupiah (+7% YoY), slightly below expectations (70% of consensus FY24F estimate). The shortfall was due to a 74% YoY drop in other income (to 45 billion rupiah) and a 16% YoY rise in tax expense. Operating profit was 1 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+18% YoY, +3% QoQ), totaling 3.1 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY) for 9M24, which is in line with expectations (73% of consensus FY24 estimate).

tickerNews.title: AUTO 3Q24 Operating Profit Declines 9% YoY; 9M24 Net Profit Up 17% YoY
tickerNews.content: Astra Otoparts (AUTO) recorded a net profit of 515 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+2% YoY, -5% QoQ). 9M24 net profit reached 1.5 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY). The deceleration in YoY net profit growth during 3Q24 compared to 1H24 (+26% YoY) was due to lower growth in other income. Operating profit was 304 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (-9% YoY, +37% QoQ), resulting in 9M24 operating profit of 793 billion rupiah (-7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: DMAS 9M24 Net Profit Up 85% YoY, Driven by 3Q24 Low Base Effect
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) recorded a net profit of 320 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (-27% QoQ), a massive nearly 39x increase compared to 3Q23's 8 billion rupiah net profit due to low revenue recognition in 3Q23. 9M24 net profit reached 1.1 trillion rupiah (+85% YoY), achieving 91% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Revenue for 9M24 reached 1.7 trillion rupiah (+72% YoY), achieving 93.6%/87% of the company's target/consensus.

tickerNews.title: MIKA 9M24 Net Profit Up 27% YoY, Supported by Margin Expansion
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) recorded a net profit of 272 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+17% YoY, -13% QoQ). 9M24 net profit reached 873 billion rupiah (+27% YoY), equivalent to 74% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The 9M24 net profit increase was driven by revenue growth (+5.3% YoY) and gross profit margin expansion to 53.4% (+320 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: HYGN 3Q24 Net Profit Up 7% YoY Despite Margin Compression
tickerNews.content: Ecocare Indo Pasifik (HYGN) recorded a net profit of 5 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+7% YoY, +25% QoQ). 9M24 net profit reached 10.3 billion rupiah (-5% YoY). The decline in 9M24 net profit was suppressed by a decrease in other income to 2.7 billion rupiah (-41% YoY). Operationally, revenue grew in 3Q24 (+27% YoY, +0.3% QoQ), but cost of revenue grew higher (+41% YoY and +1.4% QoQ) along with expansion plans into new markets. Consequently, the gross profit margin in 3Q24 fell to 36.8% (-640 bps YoY, -70 bps QoQ).

tickerNews.title: SRIL Bankruptcy Assured Not to Cause Layoffs for 50,000 Workers
tickerNews.content: Vice Minister of Manpower, Immanuel Ebenezer Gerungan, stated that the government guarantees the bankruptcy of Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) will not cause termination of employment (PHK) for its approximately 50,000 workers. The Ministry of Manpower claims that SRIL does not intend to close its factory and is focusing on continuing operations because its business and financial conditions have shown signs of recovery over the past few years.

tickerNews.title: JARR Receives 1.4 Trillion Rupiah Investment Credit from BMRI for Refinancing
tickerNews.content: Jhonlin Agro Raya (JARR) obtained investment credit up to 1.4 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI). The credit term is 96 months and is intended for refinancing.

tickerNews.title: PT Tancorp Investama Mulia Increases Holding in BLES to 11.1%
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Superior Prima Sukses (BLES), PT Tancorp Investama Mulia, purchased 73.2 million BLES shares at an average price of 241.6 rupiah per share on October 17-24, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~17.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Tancorp Investama Mulia in BLES increased from 10.3% to 11.1%.
